title: Tree Identification
description: Identify trees from descriptions of leaves and features

questions.question: Which tree has fan-shaped leaves that turn brilliant yellow in autumn and is considered a living fossil dating back millions of years?
Which tree is known for its white, papery bark that peels off in thin layers and its triangular, doubly-serrated leaves?
Which massive tree has leaves with five pointed lobes and produces winged seeds called 'helicopters' or samaras?
Which evergreen tree has long needles in bundles of five and produces large cones, and is the tallest pine species in eastern North America?
Which tree has heart-shaped leaves, fragrant yellow flowers in early summer, and is commonly planted along city streets?
Which tree produces acorns, has lobed leaves, and can live for hundreds of years?
Which deciduous conifer has soft, flat needles that turn orange-brown and drop off each autumn, and thrives in swampy areas?
Which tree has smooth gray bark, produces small triangular nuts, and has simple oval leaves with wavy edges?
Which flowering tree displays showy pink or white bracts in spring and produces bright red berries in autumn?
Which is the tallest tree species on Earth, capable of growing over 350 feet, found along the coast of northern California?
Which tree has compound leaves with 5-7 leaflets arranged like fingers on a hand and produces large, spiny seed capsules containing shiny brown nuts?
Which tree has distinctive mottled bark of white, green, and brown that gives it a camouflage appearance, and very large maple-like leaves?
Which small ornamental tree has pink or magenta flowers that bloom directly on the branches and trunk in early spring before its heart-shaped leaves appear?
Which tree has feathery compound leaves, produces flat brown seed pods, and has a wide-spreading canopy that provides dappled shade?
Which large tree has tulip-shaped flowers of yellow and orange, straight tall trunks, and uniquely shaped four-lobed leaves?
